4.9.20  6:16 pm   I tried figuring out the chords to this reaaaally cool part in "Hello Sexy Pants" and it goes like this: "Simon says(F-G#-C-Eb) I can't remember (C#-Eb-F#-G#) anything I'm doing (B-C#-E-F#) or anything that I remember (G-B-D-F#). Hopefully you don't have to listen to your own song in order to help me here but I'm curious if these are the actual chords or just chords I like that sound good when played at the same time as the song. Maybe this doesn't matter since I already like it

4.9.20  1:58 pm   which software are you learning?

4.9.20  1:49 pm   what has writing/producing those really short (<= 10 seconds) songs done for you? I'm doing that now because I am really bad at developing a melody but really good at coming up with a short melodic phrase and producing it to sound really fun and interesting. I think it is making me better somehow. I would also like to know how you learned to create longer songs that develop the melody and go to other places. It's hard for me to write stuff that doesn't "end" as quickly as it started.

4.9.20  9:42 am   I'm writing poetry, and often when I start off it feels like some of my weirder ideas just sound willfully eccentric and obscure, or just whimsical, quirk, wordiness for the sake of it. Houw do you strike that balance between free form surrealy stuffs, without distracting from the thing as a whole ?

      I would also like to say that it is very nice that you have this page where you make an effort to be nice to people.

4.9.20  8:03 am   hi, you probably wont see this but i just wanted to say, i watched some of your reality vids and its inspiring to me that you struggled with things im currently struggling with, and you managed to make a lot of cool and funny things. its also given me ideas how to manage my own workflow. so thank you for doing what you been doing, and im excited for what you have in store for the future <3
